conversation.content: They called me today. The Stanford program, I mean. [pause] I got in. I actually got in. [very quietly] And they specifically mentioned the diversity initiative when they called, which is... I don't know how to feel about that exactly. [hesitantly] Like, obviously I'm qualified, right? My GPA is solid, my research is—[defensive] I worked my ass off for this. But then there's this voice, um, this little voice that keeps asking if I would've gotten in otherwise. [frustrated] Which is so stupid because I know I deserve this, I do. My mentor keeps telling me that these programs exist because, [passionately], talent is everywhere but opportunity isn't. And I get that, intellectually. [sigh] It's just... my cousin got into Yale last year and nobody questioned whether she belonged there. [bitter] But I already know what people are going to think when they hear about me. [long pause] You know what though? [confidently] Maybe that's exactly why I need to be there. Maybe breaking down those doors, well, maybe that's part of my job now. [very excited] God, Stanford! I'm going to Stanford! [laugh] My grandmother is going to cry when I tell her. She didn't even finish high school because—[trailing off] [warmly] She's the reason I even believed I could do this. [determined] So yeah, I'm taking this spot. Every bit of it.
